oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Don Williams interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Don Williams (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks about Bob McDill -- Don Williams talks about Bob McDill writing for him and how prolific he is -- Collie introduces Don Williams -- Collie talks about Don Williams being compared to Jim Reeves and Gary Cooper -- Don Williams talks about the town he is from -- Don Williams talks about other writers on his songs -- Collie asks about the various jobs Don Williams has held -- Don Williams talks about wanting to be a writer more than anything -- Williams talks about being on tour with Waylon Jennings -- Williams says that a couple a weeks is the longest he will stay out on tour -- Williams talks about being unable to come up for a name for his band -- Williams talks about playing live shows -- Williams talks about his hobbies (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Williams, Don, 1939-2017;
